Job Description:
About the team
ZEXP is hiring an Applied Scientist to help us advance our mission to help our product and marketing teams run experiments faster, with improving methods, with more quality controls, and at a lower cost, to generate more impact and innovation.
In this role, you will research, prototype, and implement statistical and machine learning methods to improve the velocity and quality of experimentation at Zillow. We're building a world class experimentation platform to support our experimentation culture and power innovation in our Housing Super-App. We need you to invent and implement innovative capabilities to our analysis capability.
Together we'll enable scientists across Zillow to iterate, test, and quickly ship improvements to production for automation.


This role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.
In Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City the standard base pay range for this role is $127,100.00 - $203,000.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City and may not be applicable to other locations.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.

Position Purpose:
The Data Scientist is responsible for supporting data science initiatives that drive business profitability, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. This role applies industry-leading analytical methodologies for working with large datasets to extract meaningful business insight and creatively solve business problems. Data Scientists are also responsible for ensuring that developed codes are documented into a library of reusable algorithms. Based on the specific data science team, this role would need to be knowledgeable in one or more data science specializations, such as optimization, computer vision, recommendation, search or NLP.


As a Data Scientist, you will apply advanced analytics methods and algorithms for identifying trends and providing business solutions. This role is expected to present insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences and explain the benefits and impacts of the recommended solutions. In addition, Data Scientists collaborate with business partners and cross-functional teams, requiring effective communication skills, building relationships, and focus on understanding the overall business area being supported.




This position typically reports to Manager or above
This position has 0 Direct Reports



1. Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Job Title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist CLS , Medical Data Scientist
Job Description:
An Oncology Research Laboratory in Silicon Valley is actively seeking a Clinical Laboratory Scientist / Medical Data Scientist to join their growing organization.

The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will report to the Laboratory Leader, and will be a member of a growing outpatient laboratory. The CA licensed CLS will be proficient in Chemistry and Hematology, with experience with blood bank as well.

The CLS generalist will be performing high complexity testing for Molecular Diagnostic techniques, including nucleic acid extraction, PCR, genotyping and next generation sequencing. The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will be responsible for participating in reagent and assay quality control and validations as needed. The CLS Generalist will be responsible for evaluating sample integrity and adhering to relevant procedures in cases of unacceptable specimens.

The busy laboratory is supporting a cutting edge genomic testing company for cancer detection and treatment. The company uses diagnostic tests to help find cancer and make informed decisions for better cancer care.

In this role, the Clinical Laboratory Scientist will focus on Data reporting and will be responsible for: evaluation scientific publications & clinical studies and integrating functional effects of genomic variants and their associated diseases. The CLS will be responsible for: updating database with finding, maintaining and updating work flows and protocols, and working with informatics and soft wear team on creating and optimizing work flows.

The Clinical Laboratory Scientist will have the opportunity to live in the San Francisco Bay Area one the nation’s most iconic cities. The region is home to a thriving economy, a booming housing market, numerous public and private universities, beautiful mountains and beaches and endless outdoor activities.

The Oncology Research Laboratory is prepared to offer a healthy work life balance, generous salary, comprehensive benefit package, stock options and a lucrative sign on bonus.

Your Job
Our team is at the intersection of marketing with large investments, products that are used by billions of job seekers and employers, and petabytes of data. We help scale marketing efforts through technology, automation, and machine learning. Through experimentation and data analytics, we establish relationships between marketing initiatives and company goals. We partner with multiple marketing teams to continually maximize desired business outcomes of marketing efforts by applying all learnings from scaling and discovery initiatives.

Responsibilities

Work across a wide range of data engineering tasks - data extraction, data cleansing/processing, feature engineering, data integrity analysis, maintaining datasets, etc.

About the team
The Valuation team is focused on all things related to real-estate valuation. The home valuation problem is an unsolved, complicated, impactful spatio-temporal modeling challenge. We strive to empower consumers to make their best housing-related decisions by using pioneering ML techniques to present accurate and explained estimates of home valuations and related metrics. If we cannot find an existing model to fit our needs, we will invent one. The work we do is at the core of Zillow’s mission to empower the consumer and provide them with the tools to make informed decisions.
The Valuation team is behind the Zestimate and Zillow Prize, our million dollar competition to crowd-source ideas that push automated home valuation models further. We recently released our latest model - Neural Zestimate - based on our findings from Zillow Prize, and we have many exciting avenues to explore in this direction. Learn more at www.zillow.com/ai-ml.

WE ARE VERITONE
We are driven by the belief that Artificial Intelligence is mankind’s greatest invention. It is the key to building a safer, more vibrant, transparent, and empowered society. We are determined to be an active contributor to shaping our future for the better. We care about the ethical implications of AI and the prosperity and well-being of all individuals, as well as the growth and continued successes of our employees, customers, and partners.
Veritone’s mission today is more important than ever. We’re here to democratize AI and enable every organization and every person with the power of AI. What started in 2014 with the idea of providing unified access to hundreds of cognitive engines through one common software infrastructure, evolved to the world’s first AI operating system, aiWARE, which orchestrates a diverse ecosystem of cognitive engines to power intelligent automation for both commercial and government organizations. As we progress, we will continue to move humans from “in” to “on” to “out of the loop” to help them accelerate workflows, save time and costs, and uncover new insights and opportunities.

As a Lead Data Scientist on the Demand Forecasting team with Target AI you’ll develop artificial intelligence models and algorithms for our retail business. You’ll work closely with partner team data scientists and Merch business partners to continuously learn more about our business and particularly develop an understanding of the various processes we have in play. You will partner with ML Engineers and Applied Scientists on our partner teams to build solutions for business needs including development, deployment, and maintenance of algorithms and models at scale!

We aim to develop these tools to be more efficient and precise – while also making them directly available to our business team users, allowing us to quickly respond to our Guest’s needs in stores and online.

JDSAT, Inc. is a solutions company - utilizing data, mathematics, and software to create solutions tailored to each organization’s needs. We don’t believe a homogenized solution can address complex problems. We direct the design, iteration, and development of custom tools based upon each project’s unique landscape. We build our products the same way we built our company—with people in mind. All our employees are committed to maintaining and continuing to build a culture of inclusivity, positivity, and growth.

The qualified candidate will be a balanced professional training and experienced in organizational analysis, budgeting and forecasting, planning and monitoring, defining business requirements, and analyze business processes while also possessing technical understanding in the areas of data analysis, data visualization, and business analytics. The qualifying candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (Data Analysis, Computer Science, Statistics, etc.) with at least 2-5 years of field experience. About the team
The Valuation team is focused on all things related to real-estate valuation. The home valuation problem is an unsolved, complicated, impactful spatio-temporal modeling challenge. We strive to empower consumers to make their best housing-related decisions by using pioneering ML techniques to present accurate and explained estimates of home valuations and related metrics. If we cannot find an existing model to fit our needs, we will invent one. The work we do is at the core of Zillow’s mission to empower the consumer and provide them with the tools to make informed decisions.
The Valuation team is behind the Zestimate and Zillow Prize, our million dollar competition to crowd-source ideas that push automated home valuation models further. We recently released our latest model - Neural Zestimate - based on our findings from Zillow Prize, and we have many exciting avenues to explore in this direction. Learn more at www.zillow.com/ai-ml.

As a Lead Data Scientist on the Demand Forecasting team with Target AI you’ll develop artificial intelligence models and algorithms for our retail business. You’ll work closely with partner team data scientists and Merch business partners to continuously learn more about our business and particularly develop an understanding of the various processes we have in play. Our team oversees the creation and development of the Demand Forecasting quantitative platform, building the key components which allow us to evaluate the demand and prices of our products and proprietary ‘new ventures’ products. Job Description:
The Data Scientist will be developing a career for himself/herself filled with excitement!
The utility industry is in the middle of a massive transformation.
Energy generation is going from 100% centralized to significantly distributed.
Operational decision-making and control actions are going from largely manual to largely automated.
Technologies such as energy storage, electric vehicle, autonomous vehicle, robots, drones, and machine learning are either already changing or are poised to change the way electric utilities operate.
Sophisticated software applications are at the heart of all these changes.
And it’s the Business Applications team that develops and supports these applications.
As part of the team, the Data Scientist will be responsible for developing and providing support for these applications.
This role has a lot of opportunities to learn new things and come up with creative solutions to difficult problems.
The Data Scientist must be able to work with individual contributors as well as leaders at different levels, such as supervisors and managers, and gain the credibility and trust of both leadership and peers.
The successful candidate must be able to work closely with team members, peers within the organization, external partners/vendors, internal customers, and the IT organization to deliver high-quality support and solutions for business users.
A strong sense of ownership and accountability is required, to ensure the infallible quality of support and solutions that is necessary for electric operations.


Understand business requirements
Understand the data in different systems, such as Aveva/OSI PI, data warehouses, and various transactional systems
Come up with innovative ideas to solve business problems using data
Develop and maintain analytics – from rules-based deterministic analytics to heuristic analytics such as classification and Natural Language Processing
Tune database queries, to achieve optimal performance
Develop and maintain BI reports
Document all work


Join a high-performing dynamic team within our company that is working in an exciting operational environment where we are transforming electric grid technology to support the smart grid.
Within the Electric Grid Operations Business Applications organization, we are a team called Operational Business Intelligence (OBI).
OBI ensures safe, reliable, and efficient utility operations through Business Process Management (BPM) and Continuous Improvement (CI) with the use of innovative Business Intelligence (BI).
OBI owns and maintains self-serve data platform products such as the Electric OSI PI platform and data warehouses, engages with internal customers to evaluate their business processes, and builds and deploys BI solutions to improve those processes.
The data platform products are being enhanced on a continuous basis and the number of BI solutions is growing at a rapid rate.
Additionally, the OBI team is responsible for charting the path for the data strategy of the overall Business Applications organization.
The customer base of the team includes Electric Distribution Operations, Electric Distribution Planning, Electric Transmission Operations, Electric System Protection, Substation Asset Strategy, Substation Maintenance, and Substation Automation.
Our client is seeking a dynamic individual to join our team as an Expert Data Scientist.

Do you want to make the skies even safer? Join an exciting Seattle, WA based data science team in performing complex data analysis of aviation data as an Associate Data Scientist . As modern aircraft produce increasing amounts of data in operations and maintenance, analytics is required to transform that data into actionable insight for Boeing’s engineering and business teams.

As a member of the Boeing Global Services (BGS) Engineering Analytics team, the candidate will work to support other data scientists and data engineers to analyze data, perform data/feature engineering work, engage with customers, and assist in the growth of a key focus area for Boeing engineering in Safety Analytics. This BGS team is partnered with other analytics organizations to focus on identifying and solving critical safety needs utilizing in-service data and insights.

The BGS Data Sciences team is looking to hire an associate data scientist with knowledge in fields such as advanced statistics, data engineering, and experience with developing customer oriented reports and visualizations.

These skills will be used to coordinate with other Boeing engineering teams, Airline stakeholders, and other analytics teams in the effort to develop data-driven solutions for the measurement, characterization and analysis of airline operational safety.


Modifies and analyzes standardized data sets using analytics techniques such as machine learning, statistical analysis, mathematical optimization and simulation

Identifies modeling attributes and parameters

Applies algorithms to create descriptive, predictive or prescriptive models to achieve analysis and project deliverables

Investigates data characteristics, complexity, quality and meaning. Through visualizations and summarizations, defines performance, identifies trends, outliers and drivers

Prepares data for analysis, e.g. cleansing, conditioning, transforming, handling missing fields, identifying new feature variables and handling multi-variate data

Performs standard procedures in evaluation and validation of correctness of models and analysis

Supports evaluation and validation of performance of models and analysis

Supports determination of analysis requirements given business objectives

Supports determination of decision support needs

Matches data to requirements and performance metrics to support analysis

Prepares decision support visualizations and reports, algorithms, models, dashboards and/or tools. Monitors production and deployment

If you are trained in probability theory and are interested in uncertainty propagation in mathematical models, we may have a challenging and rewarding career position for you. Our company https://www.robustphysics.com is developing statistically-reduced (non-parametric) modelling algorithms and simulation-based design software as a new solution for complex and statistically uncertain problems in the wave mechanics of high frequency electromagnetics. These new tools are needed at the forefront of many exciting new technologies – bit error rates on highspeed digital lines, electromagnetic compatibility in electric and autonomous vehicles and service reliability of 5/6G wireless and IoT systems.
You will be joining an integrated team of electronics engineers, physicists and software engineers who are daily engaged in electromagnetic wave mechanics research, experimental validation of mathematical models and implementation in professional application software. We seek a PhD level mathematician (or equivalent physics, engineering qualification) to critically review our current stochastic wave mechanics models and to technically lead the on-going research, experimental validation and documentation of new and extended formulations. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate a strong background in probability theory with experience in formulating probability density functions and uncertainty propagation in mathematical models, eg. Bayesian probability theory, Fourier transforms, Mellin transforms, etc. While no previous experience in the physics of high frequency electromagnetics is required, any related interest or experience in stochastic wave mechanics would be a distinct advantage.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. Do you want to make the skies even safer? Join an exciting Seattle, WA based data science team in performing complex data analysis of aviation data as an Associate Data Scientist . As modern aircraft produce increasing amounts of data in operations and maintenance, analytics is required to transform that data into actionable insight for Boeing’s engineering and business teams.

As a member of the Boeing Global Services (BGS) Engineering Analytics team, the candidate will work to support other data scientists and data engineers to analyze data, perform data/feature engineering work, engage with customers, and assist in the growth of a key focus area for Boeing engineering in Safety Analytics. This BGS team is partnered with other analytics organizations to focus on identifying and solving critical safety needs utilizing in-service data and insights.

The BGS Data Sciences team is looking to hire an associate data scientist with knowledge in fields such as advanced statistics, data engineering, and experience with developing customer oriented reports and visualizations.

These skills will be used to coordinate with other Boeing engineering teams, Airline stakeholders, and other analytics teams in the effort to develop data-driven solutions for the measurement, characterization and analysis of airline operational safety.


Modifies and analyzes standardized data sets using analytics techniques such as machine learning, statistical analysis, mathematical optimization and simulation

Identifies modeling attributes and parameters

Applies algorithms to create descriptive, predictive or prescriptive models to achieve analysis and project deliverables

Investigates data characteristics, complexity, quality and meaning. Through visualizations and summarizations, defines performance, identifies trends, outliers and drivers

Prepares data for analysis, e.g. cleansing, conditioning, transforming, handling missing fields, identifying new feature variables and handling multi-variate data

Supports identifying best-fit data science methodology (statistics, machine learning, optimization, simulation) given the data and business applications

Performs standard procedures in evaluation and validation of correctness of models and analysis

Supports evaluation and validation of performance of models and analysis

Supports determination of analysis requirements given business objectives

Supports determination of decision support needs

Matches data to requirements and performance metrics to support analysis

Prepares decision support visualizations and reports, algorithms, models, dashboards and/or tools. Monitors production and deployment

This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.

The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.


Bachelor's degree or higher

1+ year(s) experience in SQL

1+ year(s) experience in either R or Python

Experience in working with analytics technology stacks; Azure, GCP, Teradata, etc.


Experience in Global Services business or engineering offerings


Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard


This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree

Assesses the suitability of quantitative models for intended use and purpose, evaluates theoretical frameworks of models, analyzes and verifies data used in model development to ensure relevance and representativeness, creates benchmark models and performs statistical and analytical testing using various statistical methods or techniques including machine learning, logistic regression and other statistical techniques, identifies weaknesses or issues in submitted models and proposes actions for enhancement of models. Do you want to make the skies even safer? Join an exciting Seattle, WA based data science team in performing complex data analysis of aviation data as an Associate Data Scientist . As modern aircraft produce increasing amounts of data in operations and maintenance, analytics is required to transform that data into actionable insight for Boeing’s engineering and business teams.

As a member of the Boeing Global Services (BGS) Engineering Analytics team, the candidate will work to support other data scientists and data engineers to analyze data, perform data/feature engineering work, engage with customers, and assist in the growth of a key focus area for Boeing engineering in Safety Analytics. This BGS team is partnered with other analytics organizations to focus on identifying and solving critical safety needs utilizing in-service data and insights.

The BGS Data Sciences team is looking to hire an associate data scientist with knowledge in fields such as advanced statistics, data engineering, and experience with developing customer oriented reports and visualizations.

These skills will be used to coordinate with other Boeing engineering teams, Airline stakeholders, and other analytics teams in the effort to develop data-driven solutions for the measurement, characterization and analysis of airline operational safety.


Modifies and analyzes standardized data sets using analytics techniques such as machine learning, statistical analysis, mathematical optimization and simulation

Identifies modeling attributes and parameters

Applies algorithms to create descriptive, predictive or prescriptive models to achieve analysis and project deliverables

Investigates data characteristics, complexity, quality and meaning. Through visualizations and summarizations, defines performance, identifies trends, outliers and drivers

Prepares data for analysis, e.g. cleansing, conditioning, transforming, handling missing fields, identifying new feature variables and handling multi-variate data

Supports identifying best-fit data science methodology (statistics, machine learning, optimization, simulation) given the data and business applications

Performs standard procedures in evaluation and validation of correctness of models and analysis

Supports evaluation and validation of performance of models and analysis

Supports determination of analysis requirements given business objectives

Supports determination of decision support needs

Matches data to requirements and performance metrics to support analysis

Prepares decision support visualizations and reports, algorithms, models, dashboards and/or tools. Monitors production and deployment

This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.

The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.


Bachelor's degree or higher

1+ year(s) experience in SQL

1+ year(s) experience in either R or Python

Experience in working with analytics technology stacks; Azure, GCP, Teradata, etc.


Experience in Global Services business or engineering offerings


Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree

Job Location: San Ramon
Team Overview
The aim of the Risk and Data Analytics team in the Wildfire Risk organization is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk and Data Analytics team creates and maintains digital tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Sample activities include:
Interpretation and representation of meteorological data in models that combine a range of data sources such as the electric system asset data, vegetation, and meteorology
Prediction of electric distribution equipment failure before it occurs allowing for proactive maintenance
Development of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models using Python and executed in Foundry or AWS

Position Summary

As part of the Risk and Data Analytics team under the Wildfire Risk organization, the Expert Data Scientist collaborates with a multi-disciplinary project team of data scientists, technology experts, and subject matter experts to develop and deploy models quantifying the probability of failure for the electric transmission grid assets. This individual will serve as the technical lead for development and deployment of high complex models utilizing a hybrid of ML and first principles models. This role aims to quantify risk and develop tools to enable risk-informed planning and decision making for electric grid operations

The role of Data Science at Indeed is to follow the data. We log, analyze, visualize, and model terabytes of job posting data. You have delivered challenging technical solutions at scale, with a particular focus in using machine learning techniques to optimize a product platform. You are equally happy talking about deep learning and software engineering, as you are brainstorming about continuous improvement and technology career development. You love being in the mix technically while planning for longer-term investments in a data science function.

Job Description:
Job Description

This is a hybrid role and does not require employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work off-site on a permanent basis. In the USA, this is an employee who lives more than 100 miles from their designated primary worksite. Employees may only work remote in the 48 continguous states.

The Automated Driving, Active Safety (ADAS) Mapping Software team develops and delivers mapping software solutions using artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) techniques to support GM's automated, hands free driving solutions for North America and beyond. We tackle the many challenges of map topology, scalability, real-time performance, verification and safety. The team is part of an Agile Release Train in the SAFe© framework.

The Role

ADAS Mapping is looking for a dynamic, experienced Principal Software Engineer to join our team of software engineers to help us build out the infrastructure and provide solutions for our AI/ML product ecosystems. Must have a strong background in team build, technology, system integration, data architecture, and agile software development methodologies.

The successful candidate will guide and prioritize the development and release of software for maps. You will work cross-functionally with multiple teams and stakeholders to frequently deliver high quality, production level code for ADAS features. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders to understand and ensure that the software meets our customers' requirements and scheduled milestones. As a principal Engineer, you will be responsible to triage, develop, demonstrate, test & release software for high impact projects that deliver on GM's vision of zero crashes, zero emissions, & zero congestion.

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Do you want to make the skies even safer? Join an exciting Seattle, WA based data science team in performing complex data analysis of aviation data as an Associate Data Scientist . As modern aircraft produce increasing amounts of data in operations and maintenance, analytics is required to transform that data into actionable insight for Boeing’s engineering and business teams.

As a member of the Boeing Global Services (BGS) Engineering Analytics team, the candidate will work to support other data scientists and data engineers to analyze data, perform data/feature engineering work, engage with customers, and assist in the growth of a key focus area for Boeing engineering in Safety Analytics. This BGS team is partnered with other analytics organizations to focus on identifying and solving critical safety needs utilizing in-service data and insights.

The BGS Data Sciences team is looking to hire an associate data scientist with knowledge in fields such as advanced statistics, data engineering, and experience with developing customer oriented reports and visualizations.

These skills will be used to coordinate with other Boeing engineering teams, Airline stakeholders, and other analytics teams in the effort to develop data-driven solutions for the measurement, characterization and analysis of airline operational safety.


Modifies and analyzes standardized data sets using analytics techniques such as machine learning, statistical analysis, mathematical optimization and simulation

Identifies modeling attributes and parameters

Applies algorithms to create descriptive, predictive or prescriptive models to achieve analysis and project deliverables

Investigates data characteristics, complexity, quality and meaning. Through visualizations and summarizations, defines performance, identifies trends, outliers and drivers

Prepares data for analysis, e.g. cleansing, conditioning, transforming, handling missing fields, identifying new feature variables and handling multi-variate data

Supports identifying best-fit data science methodology (statistics, machine learning, optimization, simulation) given the data and business applications

Performs standard procedures in evaluation and validation of correctness of models and analysis

Supports evaluation and validation of performance of models and analysis

Supports determination of analysis requirements given business objectives

Supports determination of decision support needs

Matches data to requirements and performance metrics to support analysis

Prepares decision support visualizations and reports, algorithms, models, dashboards and/or tools. Monitors production and deployment

This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.

The position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.


Bachelor's degree or higher

1+ year(s) experience in SQL

1+ year(s) experience in either R or Python

Experience in working with analytics technology stacks; Azure, GCP, Teradata, etc.


Experience in Global Services business or engineering offerings


Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. Master). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard


This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.


Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.


This position is for 1st shift.


This is a union-represented position.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree


At Pacific Life, the work we do matters. We work passionately each day to drive our company forward while enjoying job security, flexible scheduling, and great opportunities for career growth. If you are a self-starter who appreciates creativity and individuality in your colleagues – even better. We look forward to receiving your application.

At Pacific Life we believe you belong. We foster a culture of belonging, a space where all employees are empowered to be authentic. We embrace and celebrate diversity, create a culture of equity and inclusion, and value and respect every employee.

The role of Data Science at Indeed is to follow the data. We log, analyze, visualize, and model terabytes of job posting data. Our Data Scientists build and implement machine learning models to make timely decisions. Each of us is a mixture of a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer. We have a passion for building and improving Internet-scale products. We seek to understand human behavior via careful experimentation and analysis, to "help people get jobs".

We are a growing team of data science professionals dedicated to ensuring the success of Indeed’s SMB business unit. As a technical lead of this team, you will work directly with SMB leadership, product management, and a team of data scientists to identify and influence medium- and long-term strategy across Indeed products. You will address business needs by guiding multiple product teams in the conception and implementation of data science solutions to improve the SBM platform. You will serve as a mentor for junior scientists, providing both technical and career guidance. You have high standards and will take pride in Indeed like we do as well as push us to be better. You have delivered challenging technical solutions at scale, with a particular focus in using machine learning techniques to optimize a product platform. You are equally happy talking about deep learning and software engineering, as you are brainstorming about continuous improvement and technology career development. You love being in the mix technically while planning for longer-term investments in a data science function.

Aon is looking for a Senior Health Statistician / Data Scientist to join the Health Commercial Analytics team
(Atlanta, Austin, Chicago, Denver, virtual workers will be considered (TX, FL Virtual)

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of the Commercial Analytics team within Aon.
This role will involve working with large health claims datasets to support the broader health actuarial and consulting practice in assisting clients with data-driven insights.

Duties and Responsibilities: Oversee methodologies for dynamic team focused on healthcare data and innovation Build statistical and machine learning models on large health claims and risk datasets such as eligibility data, medical claims and prescription drug claims data Collaborate with data engineering team on data pipelines Translate and simplify results for presentation to clients Lead the design, development and deployment of advanced statistical models Work in collaboration with external healthcare carriers, data vendors and startups Be up-to-date on upcoming vendors and startups in the healthcare space in areas such as healthcare navigation, digital health and care delivery Manage the evaluation of healthcare costs, outcomes, utilization and major drivers Design visualization tools and reporting automation to communicate end-results to client teams
Support client teams and actuaries with data related requests
Develop validation and quality control methodologies


7+ years’ experience in data science or statistics (or PhD with 2+ years)
3+ years’ experience in health and benefits ecosystem at a c onsulting firm, broker, health insurance carrier or health analytics team Experience in data cleaning, exploratory analysis, predictive analytics
Experience designing and leading data science projects and/or teams Have detailed understanding of medical claims reporting and billing
Experience working with large health claims datasets Strong applied statistics skills such as model training and validation, causal inference methods, statistical testing Degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, computer science or other related fields. (PhD/Master’s degree preferred) Proficient in R, Python, SQL Experience with Spark/Databricks and R/Python IDEs is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Excel/VBA, Word, Power Point Experience with data visualisation tools: Tableau/Power BI/plotly/shiny Good communication skills, both oral and in writing Good organization and time management skills; ability to work independently

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer - AI/ML Software Defined Vehicle
Job Description:
Job Description

This is a hybrid role and does not require employee to be on-site full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work off-site on a permanent basis. In the USA, this is an employee who lives more than 100 miles from their designated primary worksite. Employees may only work remote in the 48 continguous states.

The Automated Driving, Active Safety (ADAS) Mapping Software team develops and delivers mapping software solutions using artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) techniques to support GM's automated, hands free driving solutions for North America and beyond. We tackle the many challenges of map topology, scalability, real-time performance, verification and safety. The team is part of an Agile Release Train in the SAFe© framework.

The Role

ADAS Mapping is looking for a dynamic, experienced Principal Software Engineer to join our team of software engineers to help us build out the infrastructure and provide solutions for our AI/ML product ecosystems. Must have a strong background in team build, technology, system integration, data architecture, and agile software development methodologies.

The successful candidate will guide and prioritize the development and release of software for maps. You will work cross-functionally with multiple teams and stakeholders to frequently deliver high quality, production level code for ADAS features. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders to understand and ensure that the software meets our customers' requirements and scheduled milestones. As a principal Engineer, you will be responsible to triage, develop, demonstrate, test & release software for high impact projects that deliver on GM's vision of zero crashes, zero emissions, & zero congestion.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree

Your Job
Your Job
The role of Data Science at Indeed is to follow the data. We log, analyze, visualize, and model terabytes of job posting data. Our Data Scientists build and implement machine learning models to make timely decisions. Each of us is a mixture of a statistician, scientist, machine learning expert, and engineer. We have a passion for building and improving Internet-scale products. We seek to understand human behavior via careful experimentation and analysis, to "help people get jobs".

We are a growing team of data science professionals dedicated to ensuring the success of Indeed’s SMB business unit. As a technical lead of this team, you will work directly with SMB leadership, product management, and a team of data scientists to identify and influence medium- and long-term strategy across Indeed products. You will address business needs by guiding multiple product teams in the conception and implementation of data science solutions to improve the SBM platform. You will serve as a mentor for junior scientists, providing both technical and career guidance. You have high standards and will take pride in Indeed like we do as well as push us to be better. You have delivered challenging technical solutions at scale, with a particular focus in using machine learning techniques to optimize a product platform. You are equally happy talking about deep learning and software engineering, as you are brainstorming about continuous improvement and technology career development. You love being in the mix technically while planning for longer-term investments in a data science function.

(Atlanta, Austin, Chicago, Denver, virtual workers will be considered (TX, FL Virtual)

As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of the Commercial Analytics team within Aon.
This role will involve working with large health claims datasets to support the broader health actuarial and consulting practice in assisting clients with data-driven insights.

Duties and Responsibilities: Oversee methodologies for dynamic team focused on healthcare data and innovation Build statistical and machine learning models on large health claims and risk datasets such as eligibility data, medical claims and prescription drug claims data Collaborate with data engineering team on data pipelines Translate and simplify results for presentation to clients Lead the design, development and deployment of advanced statistical models Work in collaboration with external healthcare carriers, data vendors and startups Be up-to-date on upcoming vendors and startups in the healthcare space in areas such as healthcare navigation, digital health and care delivery Manage the evaluation of healthcare costs, outcomes, utilization and major drivers Design visualization tools and reporting automation to communicate end-results to client teams
Support client teams and actuaries with data related requests
Develop validation and quality control methodologies

3+ years’ experience in health and benefits ecosystem at a c onsulting firm, broker, health insurance carrier or health analytics team Experience in data cleaning, exploratory analysis, predictive analytics
Experience designing and leading data science projects and/or teams Have detailed understanding of medical claims reporting and billing
Experience working with large health claims datasets Strong applied statistics skills such as model training and validation, causal inference methods, statistical testing Degree in actuarial science, mathematics, statistics, computer science or other related fields. (PhD/Master’s degree preferred) Proficient in R, Python, SQL Experience with Spark/Databricks and R/Python IDEs is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Excel/VBA, Word, Power Point Experience with data visualisation tools: Tableau/Power BI/plotly/shiny Good communication skills, both oral and in writing Good organization and time management skills; ability to work independently

The Automated Driving, Active Safety (ADAS) Mapping Software team develops and delivers mapping software solutions using artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) techniques to support GM's automated, hands free driving solutions for North America and beyond. We're seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our growing team. You'll play a critical role on our Data Science team and be instrumental in driving long-term growth for the company. The ideal candidate has strong analytical and problem-solving abilities and is excited by the opportunity to navigate large amounts of data to identify patterns, distill insights, and solve complex problems. This is a highly visible role with significant autonomy and the opportunity to work across several teams.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Position Purpose:
The Data Scientist is responsible for supporting data science initiatives that drive business profitability, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. This role applies industry-leading analytical methodologies for working with large datasets to extract meaningful business insight and creatively solve business problems. Data Scientists are also responsible for ensuring that developed codes are documented into a library of reusable algorithms. Based on the specific data science team, this role would need to be knowledgeable in one or more data science specializations, such as optimization, computer vision, recommendation, search or NLP.


As a Data Scientist, you will apply advanced analytics methods and algorithms for identifying trends and providing business solutions. This role is expected to present insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences and explain the benefits and impacts of the recommended solutions. In addition, Data Scientists collaborate with business partners and cross-functional teams, requiring effective communication skills, building relationships, and focus on understanding the overall business area being supported.

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Job Description:
Pacific Life is investing in bright, agile, and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. We’re actively seeking a talented Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team in Newport Beach, CA. This role can be on-site or 100% remote.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you’ll play a key role in Pacific Life’s growth and long-term success by providing model driven insights to business partners such as Marketing, Sales, Actuarial sciences Compliance, Operations, IT and Sales in a Do/Partner/Support model. If you have worked on projects with business partners to deliver insights through analytical modelling and rapid hypothesis testing, you’re a great fit for this role. Currently, our profitable team is employing Machine Learning, and cutting-edge data structures, while also working to drive ROI through traditional methods such as General Linear Models, clustering, and decision trees. We also enable business functions to build models and perform analysis themselves through our Community of Practice.

Reporting to the Director of Advanced Analytics, the individual contributor will be able to work with business units to understand their needs and work independently to deliver a potential analytical solution be it actionable insights or an operational model in production that drives quantifiable value.


This will involve opportunities to choose the right model to and obtain insights for the business use case. Models include time series, clustering, statistics, and more advanced methods. Model design includes envisaging metrics related to eventual “value provided”.

The Analytics team members work with our internal clients and function as the SME liaison for their area of business. This includes engaging with the business partners to frame “the right question to ask”. The scope of engagement includes managing the analytics project life cycle in an agile framework.

The Senior data scientist will have an opportunity to be an ambassador for the Advanced Analytics team and to opine on / participate in sourcing and assessing new technologies in the analytics space. Data scientists also help propagate the knowledge of their craft across the business.


6+ years of experience, including 4+ years in analytical modeling

Proficiency in statistical analysis, quantitative analytics, forecasting/predictive analytics, multivariate testing, and optimization algorithms

Fluency with design and analysis of experiments (A/B testing) and adaptive sampling methods

Experience working directly with business partners to provide solutions to complex problems

Technical skills in modeling (AI/machine learning, DataRobot, H2O driverless AI, R and/or Python), and data processing (Alteryx, Tableau Prep, SQL and/or Knime)

Strong communication and interpersonal skills that align with the people-first culture at PL in an “Agile” mindset

Track record of collaborative delivery; strong willingness to teach others

Passionate about achieving results and comfortable operating in uncharted territory

Undergraduate Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or similar quantitative curriculum


Marketing and web analytics experience including Salesforce, TCRM, Datorama and Adobe Analytics

Financial Services experience, particularly in the Life Insurance and Retirement industry

Consulting, client relationship and project management experience

Knowledge of visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)

Business related or other Master’s degree

Join Target’s Artificial Intelligence team where you will define and shape what the future of retail looks like! In Target Demand Forecasting team, the Sr D Scientist contributes as follows:

Job Location: San Ramon
Team Overview
The aim of the Risk and Data Analytics team in the Wildfire Risk organization is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk and Data Analytics team creates and maintains digital tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Sample activities include:
Interpretation and representation of meteorological data in models that combine a range of data sources such as the electric system asset data, vegetation, and meteorology
Prediction of electric distribution equipment failure before it occurs allowing for proactive maintenance
Development of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models using Python and executed in Foundry or AWS

Position Summary

As part of the Risk and Data Analytics team under the Wildfire Risk organization, the Expert Data Scientist collaborates with a multi-disciplinary project team of data scientists, technology experts, and subject matter experts to develop and deploy models quantifying the probability of failure for the electric transmission grid assets. This individual will serve as the technical lead for development and deployment of high complex models utilizing a hybrid of ML and first principles models. This role aims to quantify risk and develop tools to enable risk-informed planning and decision making for electric grid operations

(continued on second page)


Gathers, cleans, transforms, and/or reduces data from dissimilar sources from across PG&E.
Performs exploratory data analysis (EDA) to produce actionable insights.
Appropriately applies statistical and analytical modeling methods such as classification, regression, clustering, anomaly detection, neural networks, Bayesian etc. using Python.
Works collaboratively with other data scientists through an iterative Agile project development lifecycle
Assesses business implications associated with modeling assumptions, inputs, methodologies, technical implementation, analytic procedures and processes, and advanced data analysis
Works with company subject matter experts to understand application and potential of data analytic solutions to create value for end-user
D ocuments data sources, methodology, and model evaluation metrics
Presents findings and makes recommendations to management and other stakeholders

Demonstrated understanding of physics-based models that simulate decay, corrosion, or wear of structures, catenary cables, steel components, etc.

Experience working collaboratively on a development or analytics team

Demonstrated proficiency with model development for decision analysis, forecasting, or other complex quantitative modeling

Demonstrated e xperience working with large datasets and knowledgeable about parallelization
Strong understanding of statistics and experience developing supervised & unsupervised learning models

Job Location: San Ramon
Team Overview
The aim of the Risk and Data Analytics team in the Wildfire Risk organization is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk and Data Analytics team creates and maintains digital tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Sample activities include:
Interpretation and representation of meteorological data in models that combine a range of data sources such as the electric system asset data, vegetation, and meteorology
Prediction of electric distribution equipment failure before it occurs allowing for proactive maintenance
Development of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models using Python and executed in Foundry or AWS

Job Location: San Ramon
Team Overview
The aim of the Risk and Data Analytics team in the Wildfire Risk organization is to enhance the risk practices of PG&E’s Electric Operation business and thereby address changing external conditions such as climate change. To this end the Risk and Data Analytics team creates and maintains digital tools to enable PG&E to close the gap between metrics and electric system performance. These tools provide a multi-layered view of risk across the electric system so that decision-making processes include and empower employees at all levels of the company to manage risk appropriately.

Sample activities include:
Interpretation and representation of meteorological data in models that combine a range of data sources such as the electric system asset data, vegetation, and meteorology
Prediction of electric distribution equipment failure before it occurs allowing for proactive maintenance
Development of supervised and unsupervised machine learning models using Python and executed in Foundry or AWS

Position Summary

As part of the Risk and Data Analytics team under the Wildfire Risk organization, the Expert Data Scientist collaborates with a multi-disciplinary project team of data scientists, technology experts, and subject matter experts to develop and deploy models quantifying the probability of failure for the electric transmission grid assets. This individual will serve as the technical lead for development and deployment of high complex models utilizing a hybrid of ML and first principles models. This role aims to quantify risk and develop tools to enable risk-informed planning and decision making for electric grid operations

Gathers, cleans, transforms, and/or reduces data from dissimilar sources from across PG&E.
Performs exploratory data analysis (EDA) to produce actionable insights.

Works collaboratively with other data scientists through an iterative Agile project development lifecycle
Assesses business implications associated with modeling assumptions, inputs, methodologies, technical implementation, analytic procedures and processes, and advanced data analysis
Works with company subject matter experts to understand application and potential of data analytic solutions to create value for end-user
D ocuments data sources, methodology, and model evaluation metrics
Presents findings and makes recommendations to management and other stakeholders

Demonstrated understanding of physics-based models that simulate decay, corrosion, or wear of structures, catenary cables, steel components, etc.
